comments.body: It is called MINECRAFT not DESIGNAMOBDROPFARMCRAFT. In other words you have to go out and kill mobs yourself; though yes you can make contraptions that do a lot of very useful things, it is a survival game not a factory design game.

406795646711 , i know , but it would be very useful on a server i play on sometimes , it is anarchy survival server and i cant go out because that server dont even checking for cheaters , most times cheaters are just killing me because they somehow flying and i just cant flee

1) This idea is old and very commonly suggested

2) That's just slime used on sticky pistons but for other blocks, also a common suggestion.

3) This idea is so random and op. Why is it included in a post about pistons?

Please keep separate ideas to their own posts so we can vote on ideas we like without the conversation getting confused with too many items.

The skulk sensor is redstone filterable. Meaning you can use its signal output strength to sort the inputs it's receiving. This means you can program your door to only respond to footsteps and your bonemeal dispenser to only respond to crops being planted. What's even better, you can do these both with the same skulk sensor.
This is my account, I can’t sign in, as this is my Microsoft account, it prompts me to sign in with Microsoft, how can I sign in as my normal account? I’m ShinyMew76

As I understand it, Java redstone is the definitive redstone system. Last I heard, Bedrock redstone is inconsistent, making it difficult to work with, despite not having some of the same glitches.

They'd also probably have to add a lot of new stuff just to bring back the potential they'd lose by removing all these quirks. Flying machines aren't even possible in Bedrock.

No, you just have to get both versions to get all the features. I have experimented with the “bugs”, and they can make sense! Think of it this way: on 1 tick pulses sticky pistons spit out their blocks because the speed of the pulse causes the slime to temporarily deform, thus not being able to retract the block.

I don't know what you mean by redstone going "through transparent blocks". It doesn't, but whatever.

As for BUD powering, it wasn't removed, because the community spoke up and pointed out that BUD powering makes things possible that wouldn't otherwise be possible. The system makes sense if you care to learn it, but if you don't redstone will still work fine for you. Removing it now would be going backwards in redstone capability for literally no benefit.
Ever heard of repeaters observers, torch towers, comparators, or sticky block pushers? It is already possible to move signals side-by-side. This idea is so over-posted and unnecessary.

Ah shucks, how did you read my mind?

Crafting a rusted door/trapdoor would require the door that is being used used and copper nuggets surrounding it on all but three adjacent sides for a total of five copper nuggets.
i understand u

I understand your idea, however I don't agree with how you think of Sculk Sensors as observers. Just have a look on Twitter or Instagram and you will see so many unique creations using Sculk Sensors that were only possible using Command Blocks beforehand. Sculk Sensors could be used to detect any vibrations, not just the breaking or placing of blocks in a certain area like Observers do. You can create systems and contraptions that only trigger when certain actions happen in certain areas using Wool Occlusion and Comparators to determine frequency of vibrations. I've seen people make dynamic pixel art on huge scales using Sculk Sensors, and even making touchpads! I'm not criticizing your idea, I'm just telling you that the possibilities and creative potential of Sculk Sensors exceeds that of almost every other Redstone component, even when it comes to Survival based contraptions like building mob traps or mob farms (for instance, you can make a grinder that is triggered by the movement of mobs inside the mob farm).
Alternatively, have the comparator be able to detect when a bed has a player in it, rather than adding a new bed?

What about a sticky redstone torch that could be placed on any surface (including the bottom of a block) and functioned like a regular redstone torch on the top of a block (e.g. powering the block the glowing tip is facing)?
A really good point for Mumbo Jumbo!!

Jumping in early, because I realized this is asking for more than I thought. The effect of wool being used in this way implies that other vibrations would ALSO be secluded. Such as, if you hit a wool block with a projectile then the "Projectile Landing" event wouldn't happen under the same logical extensions.

That's, a touch more than I was originally thinking. But still also makes intuitive sense. And so I'm probably going to ask this also be considered with the original topic of the post.
My wording wasn't the clearest, so I've attached an image that hopefully explains better.

Okay, I'm just going to leave a comment on this idea instead of posting my own because it's nearly identical, but how about a Netherite Piston?

Place a piston in a crafting table and surround it with 3 netherite ingots and one redstone in a cross pattern with the redstone as the bottom cross and the piston obviously in the middle. This Netherite Piston wouldn't need a minimum signal of 15 to be powered, though, because that would be very unfair. Maybe a minimum of 4 or 5 could work on the other hand.
This is actually what we need for making castle doors so the door would close right away and you could make elevators so I’m saying it’s a great idea

I LOVE your idea! I think that we need a type of netherite piston that have the normal crafting recipe but instead of cobble stone it would be netherite ingots and instead of wood it would be iron ingots or something else like that. It will cost a lot of items but it will be worth it if the push limit is 24 or more. I like the idea of that the signal strength will be on 15 to get it to work.

You should because i was a bedrock player and i loved it and i switched to java and i think it should be in have like how cool would it be to hear your same some like for example cat over and over again.

Why it was made at all is a mystery due to how everyone raved about the quality of these blocks. please Mojang this is the 2nd time ive come to provide feedback having played this game for over 7 years.
Been playing minecraft since Beta 1.6 and never used this site until now. Please bring back 1 tick delay.
Duplicates another post. However, there are a lot of suggestions relating to bringing back 1 tick delay of copper bulbs.

I like the idea, especially the higher push limit pistons, but I'm not sure on the crafting recipes. Maybe they could use nether brick (item not block) instead of cobble, Crimson and Warped planks instead of wood and gold instead of iron, but otherwise the same crafting recipes including slimeballs for sticky nether pistons. Not that I'm against a reason to farm magma cream, but I don't think it makes sense in this case.
As long as you can still push & pull these pistons with each other, I'm game.
Underrated idea! I think pressure plates should be able to go on ceilings and also walls too, it would allow for really cool stuff!
what about using smoke too since smoke is dense
I thought about this and found your topic! I want the exact same thing! It would be so cool, and add a lot to the game!

That would be useful.  To have the ability to say "no, I don't want you connecting there" and "Yes, connect to this thing that doesn't normally cause a connection".

I'm not sure I understand your described interface, though.

You interact with it like a repeater, but the direction that is affected is the one you are facing. For example if you are facing north the dust in the north direction will either connect or disconnect depending on what it was before

Yeah, I do think that it would be annoying to edit long lines of redstone but it would be similar to placing a long line of four delay repeaters. There are ways to build your circuit to avoid the annoyance but I would much rather have the pain of adjusting the lines than not having the option at all.

I was building some redstone contraptions and I fond it useful to place blocks on redstone dust when I wanted it above. If this idea was implemented it would possibly make building a little annoying because of the inability to place blocks as easily and just accidentally clicking on the redstone. Maybe it should only work if you are holding redstone dust.

I actually thought of an idea similar to this, but it's actually a block with 6 redstone torches in it (looks similar to repeater and comperator as it is plate like), there's one torch on each direction of the 4 sides of the block and 2 in the center, one of the center torches is higher than the others to represent upwards while the other one downwards, now whichever torch you are "lighting" whenever the block recieves a signal it'll send signal to all the directions that the lightened torches face, it also maintains the same signal power it recieved.

I thought the best way to craft it is 3 (any) stone blocks at the bottom (like for repeater and comperator) and 6 redstone torches at the rest of the slots (which fits the exact amount of redstone torches in this block).

I tried to suggest it here but it appears an idea similar to it was already suggested, that's how I came here.

This would be a wonderful addition that would also satisfy all the hype about redstone wires next to each other. Also powering a line of pistons on the same level for example wouldn't also need a line of repeaters and would make contraptions a bit faster.
I was thinking of this kind of idea but instead of making you face a direction, just make it so that you can click the four directions on and off directly.
The scraper could be the archeology brush.

yeah, i guess it's a very good idea.

but it will never be in minecraft it's to techy
